text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea acuaria is a shrub which is endemic to the south of Western Australia.
It grows to between 0.3 and 1.5 metres high with linear leaves which are 10 to 20 mm long and 0.5 to 2 mm wide. Red flowers appear between May and October in its native range.The species was first formally described by botanist English botanist George Bentham in 1870 in Flora Australiensis,  based on plant material collected by James Drummond.It occurs among low to medium-sized trees in a variety of soils.
